A low stiffness of the structure to which the control surface is attached and a balancing mass located in front of the control surface hinge line.

variant.question: A Fly-By-Wire system is always irreversible because...

options.text: the link between the pilot inputs and control surfaces is via a computer, so the control surfaces are moved indirectly by the pilot inputs.
it is linked mechanically to a computer and then to the flight control surface.
there is a mechanical linkage between the flight control surfaces and the pilot controls. The pilot inputs move the control surfaces directly.
the pilot can reverse the inputs of the autopilot system as he/she also has a direct link to the hydraulic commands of the control surfaces.

variant.question: A flight control surface actuator is said to be "irreversible" when:

options.text: there is no feedback to the pilot's controls of the aerodynamic forces acting on the control surface.
the pilot does not feel any force when moving that control surface in flight.
there is a need to lock the flight controls on the ground.
the flight control system has an alternate means of control in case of a control jam.

variant.question:
Which of these statements about rudder limiting are correct or incorrect?
1) A rudder ratio changer system limits both rudder and rudder pedal deflection as the IAS increases.
2) A variable stop system reduces the rudder deflection for a given rudder pedal deflection as the IAS increases.

options.text: 1) is incorrect, 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct, 2) is correct.
1) is correct, 2) is incorrect.
1) is incorrect, 2) is correct.

variant.question: A primary stop is mounted on an elevator control system in order to

options.text: restrict the range of movement of the elevator.
maintain constant control cable tension.
restrict the range of movement of the control column.
prevent overloading of control cables.

variant.question: An artificial feel unit is necessary in the pitch channel of a flight control system when:

options.text: the elevators are actuated by irreversible servo-control units.
the elevators are fitted with servo-tabs or trim tabs.
the elevators are actuated by reversible servo-control units.
there is a trimmable stabilizer.

variant.question: What is the basic principle of a fully manual flight control system?

options.text: The flight control surfaces are connected to the flight deck controls by means of mechanical links only.
The deflection angle of the flight control surface will vary with airspeed, therefore, the flight control forces are constant.
A fully manual flight control system is manually operated by the pilot by means of the flight control elements and is powered by a hydraulic system.
A fully manual flight control system is an irreversible system because there is no flight deck flight control feedback when a flight control surface is in motion.

options.text: 1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.
Both 1 and 2 are correct.
Both 1 and 2 are incorrect.
1 is correct, 2 is incorrect.

options.text: Both 1 and 2 are incorrect.
1 is correct, 2 is incorrect.
Both 1 and 2 are correct.
1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.

The last input would take priority over the first.

options.text: In Alternate Law the system will still provide the basic control laws but angle of attack protection and other protections may be lost.

mechanical power transmitted by steel wires.

fixing both control columns to each other so that increased force can be exerted by both pilots.
fixing dual control runs to each other combined with one actuator per control surface with a separate hydraulic source.

comes in to operation when the pilot is unable to select slats.

must be equipped with control locks.
is flown without the use of an artificial feel system.

variant.question:
The advantages of fly-by-wire control are:
1) reduction of the electric and hydraulic power required to operate the control surfaces.
2) lesser sensitivity to lightning strike.
3) direct and indirect weight saving through simplification of systems.
4) immunity to different interfering signals.
5) improvement of piloting quality throughout the flight envelope.
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:

options.text: Some form of back-up mode is required in the event of total computer failure.
In “Direct Law”, mechanical linkage to all control surfaces remains available.
Any form of computer failure will affect the aircraft handling.
Control of the aircraft is lost if the computer system fails completely.

Yes, but trimming is only possible when the autopilot is engaged.
No, because without trim tabs trimming is not possible.

It is fitted to assist the pilot to move the controls and provides decreased assistance as the speed increases.
It is fitted to assist the pilot to move the controls and provides increased assistance as the speed increases.
It is fitted to prevent over-stressing of the aircraft and provides decreased forces as the speed increases.
